Introduction

SQL (Structured Query Language) is widely considered to be the main database language.

SQL is used with multiple Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS). Three of the most popular are as follows:

  • Oracle
  • MySQL
  • Microsoft SQL Server
Syntax

SQL selects records from tables through the use of SQL statements.

The following statement selects all records from the "Computer" table:

SELECT * FROM Computers;

All records are selected in the table by using asterisk (*).

Select Statement

As the name implies, a Select statement selects records in a database. The following statement selects all computer names from the Computers table:

SELECT ComputerName
FROM Computers;

By assigning names after SELECT, all records are returned for the given columns.

Where Statement

The Where statement returns records that meet a certain condition.

The following statement selects all computer numbers from the Computers table with a number greater than 10:

SELECT ComputerNumber
FROM Computers
WHERE ComputerNumber > 10;

The Where statement allows additional filtering for selecting specific records.

Join Statements

There are multiple types of Join statements:

  • Inner Join: Returns all records that have matching values in both tables
  • Left Outer Join: Returns all records from the left table, but only the records with matching values in the right table
  • Right Outer Join: Returns all records from the right table, but only the records with matching values from the left table
  • Full Outer Join: Returns all records when there are matches in either the left or right table.

The following statement selects all computer numbers with matching tickets:

SELECT Computers.ComputerNumber, Tickets.TicketNumber
FROM Computers
INNER JOIN Tickets ON Computers.Department = Tickets.Department;

The following statement selects all computer numbers and any ticket numbers associated with them:

SELECT Computers.ComputerNumber, Tickets.TicketNumber
FROM Computers
LEFT JOIN Tickets ON Computers.Department = Tickets.Department;
